website_summaries.verdict: This sturdy, high-capacity model in single- or seven-speed versions is a real bargain.
pros: Easy adjustment of swept-back handlebars and well-padded seat makes it simple to adapt to different riders
Durable steel frame rated for up to 300 pounds
7-speed model features quality Shimano gears, reducing your effort on hills
Large basket for shopping, picnics, etc
cons: Hard-to-follow instructions and some difficulty with assembly

customer_reviews.title: That my bike was not what I ordered because of description given
customer_reviews.text: On Amazon web site, describes bike as single seven speed and it's only singe speed, the box was torn up bolts missing and bolts striped that are on bike. This is the worst purchase I've gotten for Amazon and the most I've spent at one time and will also be the last. Very very unhappy with purchase. I all so need a new front fork for trike because the one I got is bent so won't ride because broke doesn't work right

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed with product or customer service!
customer_reviews.text: The trike arrived ahead of schedule....so shipping was prompt. However, the trike had several deep scratches on it which could not have happened in shipping. I have contacted the seller once and was asked to send pictures which I did. I have not heard from the seller in five days. I could not recommend this trike to anyone. Cheaply made and customer service is poor.

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the money
customer_reviews.text: The box came all banged up. The contents were banged up as well. A pedal was striped and I think the rear 'axel' may be out of wake. Thank goodness I had a cyclist friend put this together the instructions are AWEFUL! Adjusting the seat is a bear. Who designed that mechanism? URGH! Seat just adequate. On a positive note a severely visually impaired guy is riding a bike! 9/21 follow up- front tire goes out of alignment when breaking, rear wells wobble, chain fender cover doesn't match the color of the bike, rear tires rub on fenders, peddle bar rubs on fender cover. Not happy. Cheers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Little Disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: When I first recieced this item (as it was a gift for my Wife), we both were excited. It took me a little north of 2 hours to put it together. It took me a bit of a minute to put together the drivetrain, but it wasn't as much as a setback as I running into a bent front rim! While the wheel rolls, you can't use the brakes on the rim. So, I'll have to order a spoke wrench to fix the problem. But all in all, my Wife loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Scientific7154

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!!
customer_reviews.text: The company reached out to us after the review was posted in an effort to make things right, GREAT customer service! Worth 2 stars just to have someone reach out and make it right. Well, after unboxing the bike, we discovered, like many other reviewers, parts were missing. The tools and parts did not match instructions nor were all the pieces included. Thankfully my husband had the tools(Allen wrenches that can turn in the space needed) to complete most of the assembly, what we are missing he will create from stuff around our home or buy at Wal-Mart (the chain repair and basket holder parts).
customer_reviews.author: Joe Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the money

customer_reviews.title: A good bike for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good bike. The fenders were bent, really one that seemed to be from shipping. I he others not perfect, but the nature of them- thin metal. I put it basically together easily, but dropped it of at a bike shop to put the chain on, change it shifter to a trigger and set the brakes. The basket isn't the best, five parts twisted and pinched together. I might get a different basket. For the price, it's a good bike.
customer_reviews.author: Toby

customer_reviews.title: A great ride!
customer_reviews.text: The Tricycle arrived as promised. There were some scratches on the frame and one fender was bent. The spokes on one wheel were warped and it had to be repaired by a bike shop but all in all the tricycle was nice. It rides great and is a lot of fun. We would order again.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome

customer_reviews.title: Hard install
customer_reviews.text: The gears are too small and it’s very hard to pedal and ride. Install was very difficult and instructions were horrible. I will be changing out the gears to make it easier to ride, then I will enjoy the bike.

customer_reviews.title: parts do NOT fit and require changes
customer_reviews.text: The bike that was received has a front wheel which is too large for the fork and the front brakes will not work, so the bike is left with only a rear brake. Unless you are skilled in the construction of a bicycle, these required adjustments need to be done by a bike shop. This will cost you more money. And do NOT be lured in to purchase since it is not a Prime item and will cost you as much as the bike itself to return. The box it comes in is marked TWO MAN lift. Cannot imagine why Amazon would have even engaged with this company. Clearly NOT up to standards.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Beane

customer_reviews.title: Issue with assembly
customer_reviews.text: During the assembly i noticed there was a spacer installed on the rear axle to the right of the gears. The cause gears not to line up with the front sproket. I had to remove the axle and replace with a smaller spacer used on the left rear wheel. This shorter spacer allowed the gears to fully move to the right after the axel was reinstalled. Now everything is lighned up correctly. Is this a known issue. It took several hours to work the issue and make the fix. Can i get a spare chain for my efforts?
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Blowers
